Sigmoid¶

class layers.activation.Sigmoid.Sigmoid[source]¶

Implements the Sigmoid activation layer.

The Sigmoid function squashes any input value into the range [0, 1]. It was historically common in hidden layers but is now more often used in the output layer for binary classification problems.

sigmoid_output¶

Stores the output from the forward pass, which is needed to efficiently calculate the gradient in the backward pass.

Type:

np.ndarray

backward(grad_output)[source]¶

Performs the backward pass of the layer.

It computes the derivative of the Sigmoid function using its output, and applies it to the incoming gradient from the next layer.

Parameters:

grad_output (np.ndarray) – The gradient of the loss with respect to this layer’s output.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • The gradient of the loss with respect to this layer’s input.

  • None, since Sigmoid has no trainable parameters.

Return type:

tuple[np.ndarray, None]

forward(input_data)[source]¶

Performs the forward pass of the layer.

Parameters:

input_data (np.ndarray) – The input data from the previous layer.

Returns:

The output of the layer after applying Sigmoid.

Return type:

np.ndarray
